page.title: 14Hamlet Wood
page.content:
Hamlet Wood is an area in Coxheath that belongs to the Scouting movement. It is used by Scouts, Cubs, Brownies and Guides from the Maidstone area. This use usually consists of making use of the camping facilities at the site but it is also used for sports events and camp-fire evenings.
The wood is situated in Stockett Lane, Coxheath and covers quite a large area. There is a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees with a fair amount of grassland for various activities. There is a hut on the site with toilet facilities and a warden lives in an adjacent property.
